For the last seven years 70,000 Fatah employees have been collecting their paychecks without having to show up for work in Gaza since the Hamas coup .
Meanwhile , 40,000 Hamas supporters are also getting government paychecks for doing or not doing the same jobs .

Since the economy of both the West Bank and Gaza is largely fueled by the paychecks that come from this patronage scheme , turning off the spigot for either of these groups would create a crisis that could lead to violence .

The fact that Hamas made do with only 40,000 government employees where Fatah had 70,000 is not so much a tribute to the efficiency of the Islamists as it is one to the vast scale of the patronage system that was put in place by PA leader Mahmoud Abbas 's predecessor Yasir Arafat .
